Welcome to GoIT FastAPI hw 11-14’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.lifespan(app: FastAPI)¶

Rate limit for FastAPI. New scheme instead of deprecated “on_event” : param app : FastAPI application name : type app : FastAPI

main.read_root() → dict¶

Dummy URL for request without path and parameters

REST API service Auth¶

class src.auth.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

Class for user authentication and JWT generation

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'super_secret_key'¶
TOKEN_TTL = 15¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str¶

Create JWT access token

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Claims for JWT

  • expires_delta (Optional[float], optional) – The number of seconds for JWT lifetime. Defaults to None.

Returns:

Access token

Return type:

str

async create_email_token(data: dict) → str¶

Create token for email validation

Parameters:

data (dict) – Claims for JWT

Returns:

JWT token that will be sent in email URL

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict) → str¶

Create JWT refresh token

Parameters:

data (dict) – Claims for JWT

Returns:

Refresh token

Return type:

str

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → User¶

Get authenticated user onject

Parameters:

  • token (str) – User’s authorization token. Defaults to Depends(oauth2_scheme).

  • db (Session) – Dependency injection for DB session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Raises:

credentials_exception – Custom HTTPException for 401 Unauthorized.

Returns:

Authenticated user object

Return type:

User

async get_email_from_refresh_token(refresh_token: str) → str¶

Get user’s email from JWT refresh token

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – Refresh token

Raises:

  • HTTPException – 401 Unauthorized. If token scope is not ‘refresh_token’

  • HTTPException – 401 Unauthorized. If provided token is invalid

Returns:

User’s email

Return type:

str

async get_email_from_token(token: str) → str¶

Get user’s email from JWT token

Parameters:

token (str) – JWT token

Raises:

HTTPException – JWT token is invalid

Returns:

user’s emailobtained from JWT token

Return type:

str

get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶

Create hash for provided plaintext password

Parameters:

password (str) – plaintext password

Returns:

Hash for provided plaintext password

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=192.168.0.222,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password) → bool¶

Verify if plain_password corresponds to hashed_password

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – Plaintext password

  • hashed_password (bool) – Password hash

Returns:

Comparison result of provided hash and calculated hash

Return type:

bool

Update flag in DB to see that email was confirmed by email

Parameters:

  • email (str) – user’s email

  • db (Session) – DB session

  • db (Session) – Database session

async src.auth.user.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Update user’s avatar

Parameters:

  • email (str) – user’s email

  • url (str) – URL to user’s avatar at GRavatar service

  • db (Session) – DB session

Returns:

User object with updated avatar attribute.

User

  • user (User) – User object

  • token (str) – User’s refresh token

  • db (Session) – DB session

REST API routes Auth¶

FastAPI routes module for user authentication

async src.routes.auth.confirm_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

Endpoint for email confirmation

Parameters:

  • token (str) – email token that was sent to the user via email

  • db (Session) – Dependency injection for DB session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Raises:

HTTPException – 400 BadRequest. Token does not correspond to the user’s email.

Returns:

json message

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Existing user log in function.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – Dependency injection for FastAPI OAuth2 authentication.

  • db (Session) – Dependency injection for DB session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Raises:

  • HTTPException – 401 Unauthorized. The user’s email has not been found in users DB.

  • HTTPException – 401 Unauthorized. The user’s email has not been confirmed.

  • HTTPException – 401 Unauthorized. The password is invalid.

Returns:

json with access token, refresh token and token type

Return type:

TokenModel

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh access token if expired.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – Dependency injection for user authentication. Defaults to Security(security).

  • db (Session) – Dependency injection for DB session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Raises:

HTTPException – [description]

Returns:

json with access token, refresh token and token type

Return type:

TokenModel

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

Create email with user attributes and send via background_tasks

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – request email attributes

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – FastAPI background_tasks

  • request (Request) – Request object

  • db (Session) – Dependency injection for DB session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

json message

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Sign up a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – User’s attributes

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – FastAPI background_tasks parameter

  • request (Request) – The request object

  • db (Session) – DB session object. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Raises:

HTTPException – 409 Conflict. If the user altready exists.

Returns:

User attributes and a simple message

Return type:

UserResponse

REST API routes User¶

async src.routes.user.read_users_me(current_user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Get current user’s info. Requres authentication.

Parameters:

current_user (User) – Dependency injection for the current user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Returns:

The current user db object

Return type:

UserDb

async src.routes.user.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update user’s avatar on Gravatar service. Requres authentication.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – Avatar picture file. Defaults to File().

  • db (Session) – Dependency injection for DB session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (UserModel) – Dependency injection for the current user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Returns:

The user db object that has the avater changed

Return type:

UserDb

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Create contact wrapper. Authentication required.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – Contact attributes

  • db (Session) – Dependency injection for DB session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (UserModel) – Dependency injection for the current user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Returns:

The Contact attributes for the contact that was created

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

AI is creating summary for delete_contact

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – Contact ID

  • db (Session) – Dependency injection for DB session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (UserModel) – Dependency injection for the current user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Raises:

HTTPException – 404 NotFound - no contacts found with given ID.

Returns:

The Contact attributes for the contact that was deleted

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.find_contacts(first_name: str = '', last_name: str = '', email: str = '', db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Search for the contact by given parameter. Only first given parameter is evaluated. I.e. if first name ane email are given - search will be made by the first name only. Authentication required.

Parameters:

  • first_name (str) – Search by first name. Defaults to “”.

  • last_name (str) – Search by last name. Defaults to “”.

  • email (str) – Search by email. Defaults to “”.

  • db (Session) – Dependency injection for DB session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (UserModel) – Dependency injection for the current user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Raises:

HTTPException – 404 NotFound - no contacts found with given search criteria

Returns:

list of contacts by given search criteria

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.find_contacts_with_birthdays(days: int = 7, today: bool = False, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Get contacts from the database, whose birthdays are in next ‘days’ days. Authentication required.

Parameters:

  • days (int) – Number of days from today. Defaults to 7.

  • today (bool) – Include today or not. Defaults to False.

  • db (Session) – Dependency injection for DB session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (UserModel) – Dependency injection for the current user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Raises:

HTTPException – 404 NotFound - no contacts found with given search criteria

Returns:

list of contacts that have birthday in next ‘days’ days

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Get contact by its ID. Authentication required.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – Contact ID

  • db (Session) – Dependency injection for DB session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (UserModel) – Dependency injection for the current user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Raises:

HTTPException – 404 NotFound - no contacts found with given ID.

Returns:

contact attributes

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Get contacts from the database.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – Number of contacts from start to be skipped. Defaults to 0.

  • limit (int) – Number of contacts to be returned. Defaults to 100.

  • db (Session) – Dependency injection for DB session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

list of contacts

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update contact wrapper. Authentication required.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – Contact attributes

  • contact_id (int) – Contact ID

  • db (Session) – Dependency injection for DB session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (UserModel) – Dependency injection for the current user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Raises:

HTTPException – 404 NotFound - no contacts found with given ID.

Returns:

The Contact attributes for the contact that was updated

Return type:

ContactResponse

REST API workers Contacts¶

async src.workers.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session, current_user: UserModel) → ContactResponse¶

Create contact entry in the database

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – Contact attributes

  • db (Session) – Database session

  • current_user (User) – Current user associated with this contact entry

Returns:

Contact object

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.workers.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session) → ContactResponse | None¶

Delete contact entry from the database

Returns:

Contact object from DB or None if contact did not exist

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.workers.contacts.find_contacts(first_name: str, last_name: str, email: str, db: Session) → List[ContactResponse]¶

Search the database fro the user on a given criterion. Only first existing parameter will be evaluated.

Parameters:

  • first_name (str) – User first name

  • last_name (str) – User last name

  • email (str) – User email

  • db (Session) – Database session

Returns:

List of contacts found by the search criterion

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.workers.contacts.find_contacts_with_birthdays(days: int, include_today: bool, db: Session) → List[ContactResponse]¶

Get contacts from the database, whose birthdays are in next ‘days’ days.

Parameters:

  • days (int) – Number of days from today.

  • include_today (bool) – Include today or not.

  • db (Session) – Database session

Returns:

list of contacts that have birthday in next ‘days’ days

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.workers.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session) → ContactResponse | None¶

Get contact from the database by contact ID

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – Contact ID

  • db (Session) – Database session

Returns:

Contact object from DB or None if not found

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.workers.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Get contacts from the database.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – Number of contacts from start to be skipped.

  • limit (int) – Number of contacts to be returned.

  • db (Session) – Database session

Returns:

List of contacts

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.workers.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session, current_user: UserModel) → ContactResponse¶

  • contact_id (int) – Contact id

  • body (ContactModel) – Contact attributes

  • db (Session) – Database session

  • current_user (User) – Current user associated with this contact entry

REST API workers Email¶

async src.workers.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str) → None¶

Send email to the user.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – User email.

  • username (str) – User name.

  • host (str) – Hostname for the URL that will be used in email for confirmation. (The on that FastAPI app is running on)
